References

Lots of readings, in no particular order (unfortunately).

Computing, Ethics

Based on list shared online by Dr. Fiesler.
https://twitter.com/cfiesler/status/1336317217034612737?s=20

  • DiAngelo, R. White Fragility: Why It’s So Hard for White People to Talk About Racism. Beacon Press, 2018.

  • The Age of Surveillance Capitalism: The Fight for a Human Future at the New Frontier of Power Paperback – March 3, 2020 by Shoshana Zuboff

  • Automating Inequality: How High-Tech Tools Profile, Police, and Punish the Poor Paperback – August 6, 2019 by Virginia Eubanks

  • Technically Wrong: Sexist Apps, Biased Algorithms, and Other Threats of Toxic Tech by Sara Wachter-Boettcher

  • Ghost Work: How to Stop Silicon Valley from Building a New Global Underclass - May 7, 2019 by Mary L. Gray, Siddarth Suri

  • Design Justice: Community-Led Practices to Build the Worlds We Need – March 3, 2020 by Sasha Costanza-Chock

  • Race After Technology: Abolitionist Tools for the New Jim Code by Ruha Benjamin

  • Algorithms of Oppression: How Search Engines Reinforce Racism by Safiya Umoja Noble

  • Weapons of Math Destruction: How Big Data Increases Inequality and Threatens Democracy Paperback – September 5, 2017 by Cathy O’Neil

  • Invisible Women: Data Bias in a World Designed for Men by Caroline Criado Perez

    Harvard Educational Review. Cambridge, MA.

    of Sex Research, 20, 143–167.
